noun.description: The sale of goods to the public in relatively small quantities for use or consumption rather than for resale.

adverb.description: Being sold by retail or at a retail price.
examples: it is not yet available retail

verb.description: Sell (goods) to the public by retail.
examples: the difficulties in retailing the new products

verb.description: Relate or repeat (a story) in detail.
examples: his inimitable way of retailing a diverting anecdote

origin: Late Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French use of Old French retaille a piece cut off, from retaillier, from re- (expressing intensive force) + tailler to cut.
